info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 7:12PM EDT until July 15 at 10:45PM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
At 712 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas.
Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Greenwood.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Gravelly Branch NANTICOKE, West Branch Gum Branch NANTICOKE, Nanticoke River NANTICOKE, Number One, Prong NANTICOKE, Grubby Neck Branch NANTICOKE, Owens Branch NANTICOKE, Parker Branch NANTICOKE, Gully Camp Ditch NANTICOKE, Cart Branch NANTICOKE, Smith-Short and Willin Ditch NANTICOKE, White Marsh Branch NANTICOKE, Cedar Creek BROADKILL-SMYRNA, Cedar Creek NANTICOKE and Mispillion River BROADKILL-SMYRNA.
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN SUSSEX COUNTY
